description: '''Félix Rafael Herrera Altuna''' (May 21, 1921 – February 10, 1998), better known as '''Félix Reina''', was a Cuban violinist, arranger, music director and composer. Since the mid-1940s, he was a member of many popular charangas, including [[Antonio Arcaño|Arcaño y sus Maravillas]], [[Orquesta América]] and [[José Fajardo (musician)|Fajardo y sus Estrellas]]. In 1959, after Fajardo went into exile, he became the leader of his orchestra, the Estrellas Cubanas, which he directed until his death. A prolific composer, his most performed [[danzón|danzones]] include "Angoa", "Los jóvenes del silencio" and "El niche". In the 1950s, he primarily wrote chachachás and his [[bolero]] "Si te contara" became a [[standard (music)|standard]] of the genre.
